operations.notes:
Creates a new card inside Smart Canvas.

This operation requires the scopes: 'smartcanvas.cards.write', 'smartcanvas.cards.moderate'. If 'isAutoModerated' attribute is defined as 'true', you must have 'smartcanvas.cards.moderate' privilege.

parameters.name: x-client-id
parameters.description: Client ID required to make this API call

parameters.name: x-access-token
parameters.description: Access token. The person must have publisher or admin privileges.

parameters.name: x-suppress-response-codes
parameters.description: If 'true', the HTTP response is always 200. Default = 'false'

parameters.name: card
parameters.description: The card to be created

responseMessages.message: See Response Codes for all response and error codes

operations.notes: Returns a list of cards that matches a specific search criteria. All cards returned may also contain information such as attachments, user activities (like, dislike, etc) and comments. This operation requires the scope 'smartcanvas.cards.read'

parameters.name: x-client-id
parameters.description: Client ID required to make this API call

parameters.name: x-access-token
parameters.description: Access token. If not informed, only public cards will be returned.

parameters.name: x-suppress-response-codes
parameters.description: If 'true', the HTTP response is always 200. Default = 'false'

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search term that will be used to filter content. Smart Canvas will look into title, category, content and other indexable fields to match the search criteria. Example = google cloud

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Possible values:
  • - all (all status)
  • - approved (Card has already been approved by the moderator)
  • - pending (Card is waiting for moderation), expired (Card is expired)
  • - rejected (Cards rejected by moderators)

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale to be used. Locales used the following format [language]-[country]. If ommited, Smart Canvas will use the default locale to handle this request. Examples = pt-br, en-us

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of cards to retrieve. If ommited, Smart Canvas will use the default page size configured for this tenant. Maximum value for this attribute is 100. Example: 10

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to be applied to the result set. If ommited, offset = 0.

parameters.name: initDate
parameters.description: Returns only cards with publishing date >= this parameter. Format = yyyy-mm-dd

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Returns only cards with publishing date <= this parameter. Format = yyyy-mm-dd

parameters.name: maxAge
parameters.description: Max age, in days, of the card

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of categories. Returns only cards that have this specific categories.

parameters.name: meta-tags
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of meta-tags. Returns only cards that have this specific tag.

parameters.name: authorIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of authors. Returns only cards published by these authors.

parameters.name: communityIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of communities. Returns only cards published in these communities.

parameters.name: providerIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of providers. Returns only cards coming form these providers.

parameters.name: jsonExtendedData
parameters.description: Return only cards that contains this specific json extended data. Note: the card must have been ingested with it.

parameters.name: curationStrategy
parameters.description:
Possible values:
  • - date (default): sort by date
  • - popularity: sort by popularity
  • - recommendation: sort by recommendation

parameters.name: decaymentFactory
parameters.description: Decayment factor to be applied to the card's sort strategy based on its age, regardless the curation strategy. This number should be a decimal between 0 and 1. 0 (default) means that no decayment will be applied to the search order, and 1 means that the most aggressive decayment will be applied.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated fields to include in the response. If ommited, the response will contain all fields. See documentation for possible values. Example = title,summary,content.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of related entities to include in the response. If ommited, the response will contain all entities. See Card response structure for possible values. Examples = author, contentProvider, attachments, userActivities, permission, locale.

responseMessages.message: See Response Codes for all response and error codes

operations.notes: Updates a card inside Smart Canvas. This operation requires the scope 'smartcanvas.cards.write' or 'smartcanvas.cards.moderate'.

parameters.name: x-client-id
parameters.description: Client ID required to make this API call

parameters.name: x-access-token
parameters.description: Access token. The person must have publisher or admin privileges.

parameters.name: x-suppress-response-codes
parameters.description: If 'true', the HTTP response is always 200. Default = 'false'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Card ID or mnemonic

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated fields to be considered in the update process. If ommited, all fields will be updated. See documentation for possible values. Examples = title,summary,content.

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of related entities to be updated. If ommited, all entities will be updated. See documentation for possible values. Examples = author, contentProvider, attachments, userActivities, permission, locale.

parameters.name: card
parameters.description: Card data to be updated

responseMessages.message: See Response Codes for all response and error codes

operations.notes: Delete a card from Smart Canvas. This operation requires the scope 'smartcanvas.cards.write' or 'smartcanvas.cards.moderate'.

parameters.name: x-client-id
parameters.description: Client ID required to make this API call

parameters.name: x-access-token
parameters.description: Access token. The person must have publisher or admin privileges.

parameters.name: x-suppress-response-codes
parameters.description: If 'true', the HTTP response is always 200. Default = 'false'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Card ID or mnemonic

responseMessages.message: See Response Codes for all response and error codes

id.description: Unique identifier for a card in Smart Canvas

mnemonic.description: Card mnemonic. The mnemonic is used to compose the URL of the card.

community.description: The community that this card belongs to

createDate.description: Timestamp of this card creation. Using ISO-8601 format.

updateDate.description: Timestamp of this card creation. Using ISO-8601 format.

publishDate.description: Timestamp of this card publishing. Using ISO-8601 format.

expirationDate.description: Timestamp of this card expiration. Using ISO-8601 format.

autoApprove.description: Indicates if this card should automatically approved or not

jsonExtendedData.description: JSON data with extra information saved with this card

coordinates.description: Represents the geographic location of this Card as reported by the client application. The inner coordinates array is formatted as geoJSON (longitude first, then latitude).

meta-tags.description: Meta-tags associated to this card. Meta-tags are intented to be used by system / API only, not visible for end-users.

contentProvider.description: Information about the original source of this card

activityCounters.description: Activity counters. Example: number of likes, shares etc.

userActivities.description: Information about user activities such as like, share etc

permission.description: Security model data, includes security level and user / group permissions

id.description:
Author identification in Smart Canvas. That's a Person ID or email. If not provided, this author
doesn't exist in Smart Canvas (but it's still valid).
Identifies the provider (ID or mnemonic), the original source of this content. Example = googleplus

contentId.description: Identifies this content on its original source

contentURL.description: Original URL of this content on its provider

userId.description: The identifier of the author on the provider

jsonExtendedData.description: JSON data with extra information saved with this attachment

originalUrl.description: Original image URL on the content provider

type.description: type of this user activity (example = like, dislike etc)

counter.description: how many of this activities this card has

target.description: optional value that represents the target of this action. Examples = facebook, twitter, linkedin (for sharing)

target.description: optional value that represents the target of this action. Examples = facebook, twitter, linkedin (for sharing)

personId.description: Person ID (*TODO se email vai virar chave, esse campo não faz mais sentido)

meta.description: Meta information about the GET request

count.description: How many cards were found with this query

pos.description: The position of the last element of this list in the general listing
